result.execSummary:
Theodis D Thomas was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Theodis D Thomas was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodis D Thomas

records.addlTxt: Warrant for Commitment, signed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on May 5, 2022.
Signed by the parties and Commissioner Christopher Bailey on May 5, 2022.

02:07 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Theodis D Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  
Attorney appears as friend of the court.     

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Defendant waives his right to extradition.
Court accepts the waiver of extradition.

Parties and the court sign the waiver of extradition.
Court Commissioner signed the Order for Commitment 
State of Illinois is to be notified ASAP that the defendant is available for pick up.  
Court sets matter for a review hearing to ensure the defendant has been picked up by the State of Illinois.
Court denies the defendant bail and orders the defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
